Description: Shoulder sherd of Laconian black-figured or black-glazed pottery volute-krater; interior glazed shiny black; exterior slipped white on rim; very worn black-figure decoration consisting of black pendent lotus bud frieze with traces of added red on bud stems; dots in interstices also with traces of added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd has been attributed to the Naukratis Painter because of the lotus pattern which is similar to that on another vessel (Samos K 1445) that is most probably a product of that painter (Stibbe 1972, 271, pl. 19).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 241)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 558, no. E 33)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.01) (Phase 1)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p.391, pl. 42, no. 7)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 16)
